description.narrative:
This strategic partnership project falls under the thematic area Right to Food. Through our work Oxfam Novib and SOMO aim to achieve that more small-scale food producers and agricultural workers, particularly women and their communities, benefit from local to global public and private sector policies that protect and promote their prosperity and resilience.
This project is part of a regionaleffort to advocate for fair and sustainable practices in the seafood value chain, particularly focusing on the powerful multi-national Asian commodity traders. This element supports and aims to strengthen the Thai national civil society organization coalition to capitalize on the momentum gained by the Oxfam Behind the Barcode campaign to use the international pressure to move the national seafood suppliers. The Thai coalition will engage with the suppliers and share the issues prevalent in the sector and start a dialoguefor the resolution of the issues through changes in supplier policies and practices. The aim is to position the coalition as a critical yet constructive stakeholder.
The full project, strategy and targets that this Thai project element is part of are fully described under the project A-5450-02.

participating-org.narrative: Oxfam Great Britain in Indonesia works with local partner organisations and communities to bring about practice and policy changes which will significantly impact on the levels of poverty and suffering faced by poor and marginalised populations. This objective isrealised through co-ordinated work at both a national and local level, focusing on the improvement of food security, labour rights,institutional accountability, education services and humanitarian assistance. From small beginnings in 1972 the Oxfam Great Britainprogram in Indonesia has developed into an operation which impacts nationally on the factors which cause poverty and vulnerability.The initial focus on livelihoods work has broadened to encompass governance, gender issues, education and humanitarian relief work,all of this being achieved through partnerships with local organisations. These partners share the core ideas and beliefs of Oxfam and are working with Oxfam to eliminate the detrimental effects of poverty.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to a sustainable livelihood
